regulationsummary: The Hong Kong Ordinance requires financial institutions and designated nonfinancial businesses to identify and verify customers and beneficial owners before establishing a relationship or conducting significant transactions, to continuously monitor those relationships, and to apply enhanced due diligence EDD for highrisk customers such as politically exposed persons PEPs or those from highrisk jurisdictions Information disclosed under the Ordinance must be kept confidential unless specific conditions allow disclosure The rules also set thresholds for when CDD and EDD are mandatory, and prescribe additional safeguards for customers who are not physically present or who are PEPs

actionablerules.obligation: Identify the customer and verify the customers identity using reliable documents, data or information from a governmental body, relevant authority, or a recognized digital identification system before establishing a business relationship
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers of financial institutions and DNFBPs, including TCSP licensees and Category B PMS registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Customer fails to provide valid identification documents
Customers information is inconsistent with public records
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Government-issued ID identity card, passport, etc

actionablerules.obligation: Identify and verify the beneficial owners of a customer who is a legal person or trust, ensuring the institution knows who ultimately owns or controls more than 25 of the entity
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Customers that are corporations, partnerships, trusts, or other legal persons
risksignalstomonitor: Ownership structure is opaque or complex
Beneficial owner is a highrisk jurisdiction or PEP
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the beneficial owner is a PEP or from a highrisk jurisdiction

actionablerules.obligation: Carry out CDD before any occasional transaction of 120,000 or more, or any wirevirtual asset transfer of 8,000 or more, unless the customer is a preexisting customer with prior CDD
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, including preexisting ones, for transactions meeting the thresholds
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Transaction details and source of funds
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the transaction involves a PEP, highrisk jurisdiction, or suspicious patterns

actionablerules.obligation: Apply Enhanced Due Diligence EDD for customers who are PEPs, have a highrisk source of wealth, or are from a highrisk jurisdiction, including additional verification of source of funds and wealth
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: PEPs, former PEPs, customers from highrisk jurisdictions, and customers with complex ownership structures
risksignalstomonitor: Highrisk jurisdiction of residence or business
Unusual or large source of funds
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, mandatory for all identified highrisk customers

actionablerules.obligation: Continuously monitor the business relationship by reviewing customer information, scrutinizing transactions for unusual patterns, and documenting findings
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, with heightened focus on highrisk and preexisting customers
risksignalstomonitor: Transactions with no apparent economic purpose
Changes in customers account activity or ownership
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if monitoring reveals new highrisk indicators

actionablerules.obligation: For customers not physically present for identification, perform at least one additional verification measure such as a secondary ID check, supplementary information verification, or ensure the first payment is made through an account opened in the customers name with a compliant institution
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Customers who are not physically present for identification
risksignalstomonitor: Use of remote or digital identification only
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Confirmation of account opening with a compliant institution
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the customer is also a PEP or from a highrisk jurisdiction
